body.name: CHAOREN Click Belt for Men 2 Pack - Mens Dress Belt 1 1/4" in Gift Set Box - Design Belt Meet Almost Any Occasion and Outfit
features: FOR EXACT FIT - Comfort click belt allows for up to 1/4" adjustments for perfect fit everywhere. The ratchet belt features an easily removable buckle that allows you to cut the black and Cognac belt to your ideal size.
EASY TO USE - Slide the mens dress belt into the sliding buckle, and the holeless belt auto-locks. Lift the automatic buckle, and pull the rachette belt to release. Simple, smooth, and sleek!
MAXIMUM DURABILITY - Mens adjustable belt with genuine leather, presenting a high texture refined look, High-density stylish buckle is lighter and SCRATCH RESISTANT which is made to last.
GREAT GIFT CHOICE - Luxury packaging comes as standard! Fashion Design track belt will meet almost any occasion and outfit, and is also the utmost suitable gifts for men.
RISK FREE ORDERS - We are committed to making our customers satisfied. If there is any problem with the product, contact us without hesitation.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Minimalist Fashion - The DNA of CHAOREN We carefully select the best designs for our customers which are suitable for any occasions and outfits. When you come to CHAOREN, being chic and stylish is effortless.
Previous page Next page 1 Exceptional Comfort 2 Perfect Fit Anytime 3 Elegant Look 4 Minimalist Fashion

Micro Innovation for Convenience Comfortable Fit With CHAOREN Ratchet Click Belt, you can simply lift the buckle for a smooth release to slightly adjust the fit at different times of the day. Enjoy micro adjustment whether you are standing, sitting, or bending over, especially church ceremony. No holes that are too tight or just loose. Extremely easy to use!

Easy to Use All-Day Comfort Ratchet Belt Steps to use: 1. Measure your waist size 2. Trim the belt to your size before wearing it 3. Locking Belt: Just slide the belt into the buckle and pull the belt through, the buckle simply automatically locks. 4. Release Belt: To release the belt, gently push the lever on the side and the lock will snap.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best thing to happen to belts ever!
reviews.reviewText: The click belt design is easy to use and fits/holds like a champ. The belt quality is very nice and honestly impressive for the price. Cutting the belt to my size and attaching the buckle took all of 3 minutes to do. I highly recommend this belt for men that tend to have fluctuating weight trends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great looking belt and fits perfectly
reviews.reviewText: Belts look to be well made, good color (basic black & brown). Fairly easy to size although directions would have been nice so that you don't second guess yourself when installing belt into buckle. Just got them so not sure about durability. Best feature is they can be tightened to exact fit that is comfortable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good quality leather, the ratcheting isn't as smooth as other belts I've tried.
reviews.reviewText: The belts look great. Two buckles, one chrome, one brushed. The ratcheting mechanism on these belts isn't as smooth or "clicky" as I've seen on other belts of a similar type. One drawback that all these belts seem to have is the way the buckle attaches to the belt. The teeth of the clamp end up pushing the belt back out some, so when you get it locked in place, it's only holding on to the very tip of the belt, less than a 1/4 inch of leather. If they just made this pocket a tiny bit deeper so the belt would slide further in, adjusting for this backing-out, I think it would make the belt a lot more usable. I've had some in the past that failed because of this, so I've learned to leave them a little longer than I really need, so when it does eventually give way, I can just cut it again and start with a new section. Otherwise, a good buy and a good belt.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars comparison of Chaoren and Mio Marino ratchet belts with photos
reviews.reviewText: I got this order of two belts, one black one brown, November 2019. These are the first ratchet belts I've ever had. So far I like them a lot. I use them every day, and like others find them fast, easy, convenient. I've not had good luck with conventional belts lasting, maybe I pull them in too tight, but I find the surface cracks and before long they don't look good, especially where the holes are. These ratchet belts don't have the holes obviously, and since you never bend them way back to fasten, so far they have held up like new.I do like how fast you can pull the lever and it pops open.The ad says the buckle is light, it certainly is NOT. The weight of the buckle does tend to pull the belt down a bit in front if worn loosely. But then again, the buckle seems pretty heavy duty and substantial.I liked these Chaoren belts, so I thought I'd try the Mio Marino that seemed to have more choices for straps and buckles. I got a flat black finish buckle and flat (not shiny) strap for weekends, yard work, and so forth. See photos.I prefer the Chaoren belt over the Mio Marino, but only because the track that the buckle engages, is extended closer to the tip, so I have only a small stub protruding out the buckle. Personal preference. You can see what I'm talking about in the picture.Otherwise, I think the same factory probably makes these, as the buckle mechanics are completely identical, and the straps are stitched and made identically. Even the gift boxes they came in are very similar.The replacement straps should work in either buckle too, as they are the same in width and thickness. I got the 1 and 1/8th width by the way, these belts are also sold in a 1 and 3/8th, so be sure you are ordering what you want.Are they leather? I think the underside is, I think the finished outer layer is synthetic. I took the part I cut off (remember you cut these to length yourself, you'll want some heavy scissors, I used tin snips) and put a flame to it and it sure seemed like the surface (outer) layer melted and smelled like burning rubber. But then there is some kind of artificial filler between the inner and out layers.They both are cut to fit (go long at first and try it), then the strap is slid into the buckle and you flip down a latch with teeth that hold it. They've stayed attached with no issues so far, and if it pulls the end of the belt off I guess I can trim a little and resnap it down. See the closeup pics.So yes, I really like the ratchet idea, I liked the Chaoren because the track goes nearer the tip, and otherwise the Chaoren and Mio Marino are pretty much identical, at least the ones I got.Finally, give me a "helpful" click if this helped you out.Update November 2021: the belts are still holding up fine, one I wear to work 5 days a week. I forgot I was wearing my weekend Mio Marino once when I jumped in swimming, didn't seem to hurt it. Just the once though.Update December 2022: they still work fine!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So easy to use! Fits even if you lost or gained wieght!
reviews.reviewText: Works great, the only one I will use. You just flip it up to loosen and slide it to tighten. No having to find a hole to stick a pin in. Lasts as long as any other I've had.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing belts for guys that fluctuate an inch in waist
reviews.reviewText: I regularly fluctuate in my waist about 1”-2” either way, these are perfect. I can’t state that enough. Perfect. I have abandoned my other belts and only use these. And after a couple months of use, they haven’t worn at all. They are dressy enough for my professional work environment and outside of work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great adjustable belts
reviews.reviewText: These belts are great and I highly recommend them to anyone needing replacement belts. You can cut and adjust the overal size of the belt. the micro adjustments are great and you can tighten and losen the belt with ease. Material is great and really enjoy them.
Great looking belt. Was very easy to fit to size, as cut edges show how to trim excess off belt. Works really great, just am hopeful the belt will continue to hold it's placement.
Muy buena calidad de los cinturones y las ebillas también
Great looking, and easy to cut down to size if required.
Nice looking belts made with good quality materials, should last for many years.

Its a great alternative to classic belt buckle design where we can adjust with micro precision. Though it is a bit costly for what we are getting and at this price point i will buy something from a brand where i can get lifetime of support. Buckle surface finish was not that great and there were bumps and bruises.
